overall_perception_summary.headline: The Clinical Guardian
overall_perception_summary.description: Aquaphor feels like a medical necessity rather than a beauty choice. It occupies the role of the ultimate pragmatic tool—a sterile, reliable fixer for when the body breaks down. It differentiates through absolute safety and dermatologist authority, offering a mess-free utility that prioritizes function over form.

foundation.title: The Safe Healer
foundation.description: The brand anchors its authority in the white coat, positioning itself as the #1 Dermatologist Recommended choice. It balances this clinical power with a Safety First value system, stripping away fragrances and preservatives to guarantee tolerance. The strategy is pure Medical Authority—a utilitarian staple found in the medicine cabinet, not the vanity.

identity.title: The Stoic Caregiver
identity.description: The distance between brand and user is professional; it behaves like a doctor, not a friend. Dominated by The Caregiver archetype, it uses a Pharma-Code visual identity (blue, white, sterile) to signal hygiene and trust. The voice is a Clinical Authority—dry, direct, and factual.

communication.title: Problem-Solving Science
communication.description: The messaging leads with the Benefit ('Relieves,' 'Protects') backed by Rational persuasion ('Clinically proven'). The USP is The Specialist—owning the mental slot for 'Healing Ointment' via a unique delivery system (Stick). The narrative is a Lab Breakthrough, where faceless expertise creates the ultimate skin shield.

benefits.title: Restorative Relief
benefits.description: Functionally, it acts as a Healer and Shield, offering immediate restoration to broken skin. The emotional payoff is Relief—the removal of pain and anxiety. It serves as The Pragmatist's badge, signaling a rejection of marketing fluff in favor of The Safe Choice that simply works.

marker_1.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] ORIGIN OF AUTHORITY (The Source of Power)
marker_1.reasoning: The authority is derived entirely from medical endorsement—'#1 Dermatologist Recommended Brand' is the primary seal of trust (Origin: 2/5 Derm-Validated). The mission is not to enhance or beautify, but to fix brokenness—'Relieves chapped, dry or cracked skin', 'Healing Balm' (Mission: 2/5 Restoration). Clinical authority + Repair goal = The Healer.
marker_1.evidence: #1 Dermatologist Recommended Brand... Healing Balm Stick... Relieves chapped, dry or cracked skin... Skin Protectant

marker_2.reasoning: The scope is laser-focused on micro-problems—'chafing', 'dry spots', 'chapped lips'—rather than broad lifestyle changes (Scope: 1/5 Micro-Correction). Access is universal; this is a mass-market staple available at every drugstore without a velvet rope (Access: 5/5 Democratic).
marker_2.evidence: Relieves chapped, dry or cracked skin... chafing... dry spots... convenient, mess-free format

marker_3.reasoning: The brand prioritizes tolerance above all else. 'Fragrance free', 'Preservative free', 'Hypoallergenic' are the key qualifiers, signaling that safety is the non-negotiable value (Performance: 1/5 Hypoallergenic). Transparency is functional—explaining the 'Petrolatum (30%)' active ingredient clearly as a skin protectant (Transparency: 3/5 Explained).
marker_3.evidence: Hypoallergenic... Fragrance free... Preservative free... Petrolatum (30%) Purpose: Skin Protectant

marker_4.reasoning: The aesthetic is pure pharmacy—clinical blue, stark white, and the 'Drug Facts' table layout. There is no lifestyle imagery, only function (Aesthetic: 1/5 Clinical Sterile). The product is a utilitarian tool for daily emergencies, priced and positioned as a household necessity (Value: 2/5 Daily Essential).
marker_4.evidence: Drug Facts... Active ingredient: Petrolatum... Clinical blue and white packaging... Skin Protectant

marker_5.reasoning: The personality is cool and professional. It doesn't try to be your friend; it tries to solve your problem. The tone is 'Distant' but competent (Thermostat: 2/5). The power dynamic is top-down—the 'Dermatologist Recommended' badge establishes them as the expert instructing the user (Power Dynamic: 4/5 Specialist).
marker_5.evidence: Dermatologist Recommended... Clinically proven... Skin Protectant... Warnings: For external use only

marker_6.reasoning: The primary drive is protection and healing (The Caregiver: 60%), evidenced by words like 'Protectant,' 'Healing,' and 'Relief.' The secondary archetype is The Sage (30%), grounded in the 'Dermatologist Recommended' facts and clinical data. A hint of The Ruler (10%) appears in the '#1' claim. This mix creates The Stabilizer—offering control over skin chaos.
marker_6.evidence: Healing Balm... Skin Protectant... #1 Dermatologist Recommended... Relieves... Soothes

marker_7.reasoning: Warmth Score = (2+1)/2 = 1.5 (Low). Energy Score = (1+2)/2 = 1.5 (Low). The tone is purely functional and warning-like ('Do not use on deep or puncture wounds'). There is zero humor, zero slang, and zero exclamation points. It sounds like a prescription pad.
marker_7.evidence: Do not use on deep or puncture wounds... Stop use and ask a doctor if... Apply as needed... Active ingredient

marker_8.reasoning: The visual world is stark white and clinical blue, creating a sterile temperature (Thermostat: 1/5 Sterile). The layout is rigid, using the standardized 'Drug Facts' table and bulleted lists associated with medicine, not beauty (Entropy: 2/5 Structured). This is the visual language of the pharmacy.
marker_8.evidence: White background... Dark blue text... Red accent line... Drug Facts table layout... Droplet logo
marker_8.look_and_feel: A sterile, medical aesthetic that prioritizes clarity and hygiene over beauty.
marker_8.primary_palette: Clinical white dominated by medical dark blue with alert-red accents.

marker_9.reasoning: The hook is the result: 'Relieves', 'Protects', 'Soothes'. They lead with the solution to the pain (Hook: 4/5 Result). The logic is rational and data-based: 'Clinically proven', '30% Petrolatum'. There is no poetry, only cause-and-effect (Persuasion: 1/5 Raw Data).
marker_9.evidence: Relieves chapped skin... Clinically proven... Skin Protectant... Petrolatum (30%)

marker_10.reasoning: The protagonist is the collective authority of 'Dermatologists'—no specific founder is mentioned, only the expert consensus (Protagonist: 1/5 Nobel). The setting is implied to be the clinic or the lab, where 'clinical proof' is generated (Setting: 1/5 Sterile).
marker_10.evidence: #1 Dermatologist Recommended... Clinically proven... Drug Facts... Preservative free

marker_11.reasoning: Validation is top-down from the 'Board'—the #1 Derm claim is the banner headline (Validator: 1/5 Authority). The proof is heavily weighted toward the checklist of what is NOT in the product—'Fragrance free', 'Preservative free', 'Dye free' (Proof: 4/5 The List). While clinical, the checklist drives the safety narrative.
marker_11.evidence: #1 Dermatologist Recommended... Fragrance free... Preservative free... Dye free... Hypoallergenic

marker_12.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] THE OWNERSHIP OBJECT (What You Claim to Own)
marker_12.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Hero (Owned mental link: 'We are the Oat brand')
marker_12.slider_b_label: [SLIDER] THE TARGET SCOPE (How Wide Is The Net?)
marker_12.reasoning: Aquaphor owns the mental link to 'Healing Ointment' (Petrolatum) in the US market (Ownership: 2/5 Hero). The scope is Problem-focused: 'Chapped lips', 'Dry spots', 'Chafing'. It is not a general moisturizer; it is a tool for specific issues (Scope: 4/5 Problem).
marker_12.evidence: Healing Balm Stick... Relieves chapped, dry or cracked skin... Chafing... Dry Spots

marker_13.reasoning: The content purpose is to explain usage and safety—'How to use', 'Drug Facts', 'Ingredients' (Depth: 2/5 Explainer). The intent is to build trust through the 'Thesis' of clinical efficacy and dermatologist recommendation (Intent: 1/5 Thesis).
marker_13.evidence: Drug Facts... Directions... Inactive ingredients... Warnings... Dermatologist Recommended

marker_14.reasoning: The mechanism is an occlusive shield that allows for healing—'Skin Protectant', 'Relieves' (Action: 4/5 Healer). The outcome is the restoration of sensory comfort—stopping the pain of cracked skin (Outcome: 2/5 Sensory). It fixes the broken barrier.
marker_14.evidence: Skin Protectant... Relieves chapped, dry or cracked skin... Restores smooth, healthy skin

marker_15.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Panic Mode (Urgent need to stop pain/itch)
marker_15.reasoning: This product addresses a crisis—cracked, bleeding, or chafed skin. The emotional direction is Relief from this urgent discomfort (Anxiety: 1/5 Panic Mode). The payoff is 'Comfort'—returning to a normal, pain-free baseline (Self-Perception: 2/5 Comfort).
marker_15.evidence: Relieves... Soothes... Chafing... Cracked skin... Dry spots

marker_16.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Tool (I buy it only because it functions)
marker_16.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Standard (What everyone uses; the default)
marker_16.reasoning: Purchase motivation is pure utility; you buy it because it is the tool that works for the job (Signal: 1/5 The Tool). There is no status signal here; it is 'The Standard'—the default product everyone knows and uses (Tribal: 1/5 The Standard).
marker_16.evidence: Convenient, mess-free format... multipurpose... essential solution

marker_17.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Normalization (I want to look like everyone else)
marker_17.reasoning: The social goal is Normalization—using the trusted standard to avoid risk (Social Vector: 1/5 Normalization). It connects you to The Majority, the massive group of users who rely on this household name (Group Dynamic: 1/5 Majority).
marker_17.evidence: #1 Dermatologist Recommended... Essential solution... Trusted brand
